result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven A. Martinez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Steven A. Martinez is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Steven A. Martinez was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.   AMENDED 2/24/15.  May be at the casino for employment purposes only.  May not consume or possess alcohol.   Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, with the victim.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  

Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Defendant must participate in, and successfully complete either the Alternatives to Aggression Program or Anger Management at agent's discretion.  Attend DV Court and domestic violence counseling  at agent's discretion.  

110 days credit.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge, if not already done.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

ADA Inlow appeared on behalf of the State.  No other appearances.  Defendant is trying to get a job at the casino.  Court orders that JOC be amended so that he may be at the casino for employment purposes only.

FIDR destroyed.

ADA Inlow appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody with Attorney Sebion.  Defendant plead no contest to amended count 1.  Count 2 dismissed.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights waived, elements and penalty enhancers with the defendant.  Firearm warning given to defendant.  Priors confirmed.  Court finds that the defendant has entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights freely, voluntarily and intelligently.  Factual basis exists.  Find guilty of amended count 1.  Joint sentencing recommendation made.  Court orders sentence withheld, 3 yrs. probation.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.    Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, with the victim.  CC & DNA Sample.  DV Court and programming, if agent deems appropriate.    Defendant must participate in, and successfully complete either the Alternatives to Aggression Program or Anger Management at agent's discretion.  Obtain and maintain employment.  110 days credit.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 02-02-2015 10:30 am

Defendant appeared in custody with counsel Carly Sebion.  Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Court reviews Waiver of Preliminary Hearing form and rights to preliminary hearing with defendant.  Court finds right to preliminary hearing is waived knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently.  Bound over for trial.  Proceeds to arraignment.  Attorney Sebion waives reading of Information and enters not guilty pleas.  Case was already pre-trialed will be set for plea and sentencing on 2-2-15 at 10:30.
